description: The CodeBoarding application operates as a sophisticated codebase analysis tool, leveraging an agent-based system and a modular architecture to provide deep insights into software projects. The core workflow begins with the Application Workflow & Output Manager orchestrating analysis jobs, managing repositories, and persisting data. It initiates static analysis via the Static Analysis & Code Graph Generator, which meticulously builds code graphs and extracts detailed information. This structured data is then utilized by the LLM Orchestration & Validation Engine, where intelligent agents, guided by context-aware prompts, perform advanced analysis. These agents interact with the codebase through the Codebase Interaction Tools, querying static analysis results and file contents. Throughout the process, the Monitoring & Evaluation System tracks performance and validates analysis quality. Finally, the Application Workflow & Output Manager takes the validated analysis results and renders them into various human-readable and machine-readable formats, including diagrams, for comprehensive documentation.

components.name: Application Workflow & Output Manager
components.description: This component serves as the central orchestrator for the entire CodeBoarding application. It manages the lifecycle of analysis jobs, handles user interactions, processes local and remote repositories, persists critical application data using DuckDB, and initiates the diagram generation process. It also handles the final rendering and serialization of analysis results into various human-readable and machine-readable formats, including HTML, Markdown, and JSON, often incorporating Mermaid.js diagrams.

components.name: Repository Management Utilities
components.description: This component provides essential low-level utility functions for interacting with Git repositories. It handles operations such as cloning repositories, checking out specific branches or commits, and retrieving repository metadata, ensuring the correct codebase version is analyzed.

components.name: Static Analysis & Code Graph Generator
components.description: This component is responsible for performing deep static analysis of the codebase, constructing various code graphs like Control Flow Graphs (CFGs), and extracting detailed code information. It leverages Language Server Protocols (LSP) for different languages, manages CallGraph data structures, and stores all collected static analysis results.

components.name: LLM Orchestration & Validation Engine
components.description: This component serves as the intelligent core of CodeBoarding, orchestrating LLM-driven analysis, generating context-aware prompts, and validating the LLM's outputs. It manages the central CodeBoardingAgent logic, prompt factories for various LLM models, structured data models for agent responses, and validation mechanisms to ensure analysis quality.

components.name: Codebase Interaction Tools
components.description: This component provides a comprehensive set of tools that LLM agents utilize to interact with and query the codebase. These tools act as the agents' interface to project files, structure, static analysis data, and documentation, while respecting .gitignore and .codeboardingignore rules.

components.name: Monitoring & Evaluation System
components.description: This component provides a robust system for monitoring the performance and resource usage of the CodeBoarding application, with a focus on LLM interactions. It also offers a framework for evaluating the quality of the generated analysis, capturing metrics, and generating reports.
